2019-08-04T15:11:30Z: And this is the story of all about how Hamilton overhauled Verstappen for victory. Now go forth and enjoy your summers - and we'll see you for the Belgian Grand Prix soon! Mercedes strategy helps Hamilton overhaul Verstappen for Hungary winLewis Hamilton stole victory in the Hungarian Grand Prix with four laps left after a strategy switch from his Mercedes Formula 1 team defeated long-time race leader Max Verstappen
2019-08-04T15:05:49Z: And that's four thrilling races in a row. F1, boring? Whatevs.
2019-08-04T15:04:02Z: Hamilton throws his urn up in the air, and catches it just so. A metaphor for his race, perhaps? Verstappen can keep the ashes of his hard tyres in his.
2019-08-04T15:03:08Z: The trophies today are a set of lovely Hungarian ceramic pots. These drivers have definitely...urn-ed them.
2019-08-04T14:52:01Z: It's a second consecutive P5 for Sainz, holding on from Gasly. Raikkonen, Bottas, Norris and Albon complete the top 10.
2019-08-04T14:50:33Z: Vettel completes the podium in third, 61.433s off the lead, and 3.8s clear of Leclerc.
2019-08-04T14:50:02Z: Verstappen crossed the line 17.796s behind Hamilton in second.
2019-08-04T14:49:37Z: He led only a handful of laps in the middle of the race and then at the end, but Lewis Hamilton rounds the final corners comfortably clear to win the Hungarian Grand Prix!
2019-08-04T14:47:50Z: Verstappen sets a 1m17.103s on his first full lap. Blistering pace, but too little too late of course.
2019-08-04T14:47:01Z: Kvyat appears to have run out of tyres, and now drops behind Magnussen and Ricciardo.
2019-08-04T14:47:00Z: That long first stint paid off for Vettel, even if the Ferraris are a minute behind Hamilton - who's made one stop more than Vettel or Leclerc.
2019-08-04T14:46:28Z: There's a bit of intrigue for the final podium position - or there was, at least, as Vettel has just passed Leclerc into Turn 1 for third place.
2019-08-04T14:44:55Z: Albon has dispatched Perez for the final point, who's now under serious attack from Hulkenberg.
2019-08-04T14:44:29Z: Verstappen pits now from second - presumably for a shot at a consolation fastest lap.
2019-08-04T14:43:55Z: ... and Hamilton then drafts past towards the end of the straight and into the lead at Turn 1! Race done.
2019-08-04T14:43:03Z: Hamilton is half a second behind Verstappen approaching the start of lap 67...
2019-08-04T14:41:37Z: Hamilton is perilously close to getting DRS from Verstappen.
2019-08-04T14:41:22Z: Albon passes Kvyat for 11th, in case you were wondering. In other midfield news, Ricciardo is still stuck behind Magnussen.
2019-08-04T14:39:27Z: Verstappen's next lap is a nightmarish 1m20.907s. Hamilton's is 1m18.625s! Less than five seconds separate them with six laps to go.
2019-08-04T14:38:02Z: Hamilton is another 1.5s faster than Verstappen on lap 62 of 70, and 7.5s splits the two leaders now. Eight laps remain.
2019-08-04T14:35:35Z: Hamilton sets another new lap record, and was 1.2s faster than Verstappen. Just 10 laps remain, and just over 10s separates the two.
2019-08-04T14:34:22Z: Another new fastest lap (and lap record) of 1m18.566s for Hamilton, who is lapping more than a second faster than Verstappen again. Just over 10 laps remain, and 11.6s separate the pair.
2019-08-04T14:32:29Z: Hamilton pumps in a new fastest lap of 1m19.174s, and is 13.4s behind Verstappen as things stand.
2019-08-04T14:31:50Z: In case you'd forgotten about the Ferraris, they remain third and fourth - we've even caught a glimpse of one of them on the TV coverage. Leclerc is 35s behind Hamilton, and Vettel - the last man on the lead lap - is a further 10s back.
2019-08-04T14:29:28Z: Right now, this looks like advantage Verstappen. The gap remains a pretty static 15.5s with 14 laps remaining.
2019-08-04T14:29:18Z: There's a nice battle raging between Magnussen and Ricciardo - two hard racers giving each other no quarter. All of this, battling over 14th.
2019-08-04T14:26:29Z: Verstappen goes faster than Hamilton with 17 laps to go. He sets a 1m19.560s, which is 0.025s faster than Hamilton's. The gap between the two is 15.590s.
2019-08-04T14:24:10Z: Grosjean is our first retirement, pulling into the pits and calling it un jour.
2019-08-04T14:23:50Z: And Hamilton sets a new fastest lap now - a 1m19.199s, though that was only six tenths faster than Verstappen's last lap, which was a personal best for the Red Bull driver.
2019-08-04T14:23:08Z: Hamilton's first full lap was a 1m19.404s, which was a second faster that Verstappen's.
2019-08-04T14:22:06Z: Bottas now passes Albon for 11th - Kvyat is next up.
2019-08-04T14:20:50Z: Verstappen has stayed out for another lap - so surely must be staying out for good? Hamilton gets the gap down to 19s now.
2019-08-04T14:20:15Z: 21s is the gap between Verstappen and Hamilton, with 21 laps to go.
2019-08-04T14:19:42Z: That was a much faster stop, too. Hamilton is back out on mediums after a 2.4-second stop. Red Bull, your move.
2019-08-04T14:18:31Z: Ricciardo and Bottas now come into the pits. Perez and Kvyat now leap into the points - Bottas rejoins in 12th, as Ricciardo rejoins between the two Haases in 15th.
2019-08-04T14:16:45Z: Hamilton started his recent attack on Verstappen exiting the first corner
2019-08-04T14:12:37Z: Gasly is now within DRS range of Sainz, gunning for P5. But Sainz has just gone two tenths quicker on that last round of laps, handily maintaining the gap.
2019-08-04T14:09:48Z: Hamilton reports he can't keep the pressure on. The gap has gone back out to 1.9s now, offering Verstappen a bit of respite.
2019-08-04T14:08:49Z: Away from the thrills of the lead battle, Vettel stops and heads back out on soft tyres - though only after the front-right was attached particularly tardily. He's back in fourth.
2019-08-04T14:07:32Z: ... which gives Hamilton a run into Turn 4! The Mercedes has a look around the outside, but skates out onto the runoff and has to drop back in behind the Red Bull again.
2019-08-04T14:06:35Z: Verstappen makes a small error into the penultimate corner and that gives Hamilton a chance on the straight. Verstappen stays ahead into Turn 1 - as the pair lap Ricciardo - but has to go defensive at Turns 2 and 3...
2019-08-04T14:05:29Z: Hulkenberg pits from eighth and rejoins in 15th, just ahead of Grosjean. When Magnussen and Ricciardo eventually stop, that's the gap they'll fall into.
2019-08-04T14:05:00Z: Verstappen catches Perez before the final corner, but clears the Racing Point on the main straight and has enough to keep Hamilton behind again.
2019-08-04T14:03:26Z: Leading gaps after 36 laps: 1 Verstappen; 2 Hamilton +0.781s; 3 Vettel +25.476s; 4 Leclerc +31.590s
2019-08-04T14:02:44Z: Hamilton takes the wide line again at Turn 2 as he attempts to press Verstappen, but goes slightly too wide and is now more than a second behind the Red Bull again.
2019-08-04T14:01:43Z: Verstappen responds on the following lap, setting a new personal best of 1m20.416s to keep Hamilton at bay for now.
2019-08-04T14:00:38Z: Verstappen is told to expect Hamilton to attack while his tyres are fresh.
2019-08-04T14:00:19Z: Rapid. Hamilton is now half a second behind Verstappen, as he sets another new fastest lap!
2019-08-04T13:59:56Z: Norris powers past Magnussen for ninth, holding the outside line into Turn 1 and giving the Danish driver short shrift.
2019-08-04T13:59:23Z: Hamilton's first flying lap is a stunner. a 1m19.653s is 2.1s faster than the most recent lap Verstappen managed, and the gap is now already back down to 1.5s.
2019-08-04T13:59:09Z: Bottas finally passes Ricciardo, who's beginning to flag a bit.
2019-08-04T13:58:23Z: Part of Verstappen's current advantage is thanks to Red Bull turning him around 1.4s faster than Mercedes managed with Hamilton
2019-08-04T13:58:14Z: Gasly now steams past Hulkenberg, taking sixth place. The Frenchman is the big winner out of this pit phase, and is primed to take fifth once Sainz calls in.
2019-08-04T13:57:31Z: Hamilton pits and goes for hard tyres. That Mercedes stop wasn't particularly pretty - Hamilton was stationary for 4.0s - and the world champion is now 5.9s behind Verstappen, who is the race leader once again.
2019-08-04T13:56:42Z: Norris gets the move done on Ricciardo now, diving down the inside at turn 1. Proactive move, and Magnussen's next.
2019-08-04T13:55:46Z: Regardless, Norris is having a crack at Ricciardo, who is yet to stop having started on the hards.
2019-08-04T13:54:59Z: It was also quite a slow stop for Norris, as the rear left was very slow on. Albon has a delay with his rear right tyre, coming out behind Kvyat.
2019-08-04T13:54:14Z: That must have been a lightning stop for Gasly, as he's managed to leapfrog Norris at that stop. Norris is stuck in the train behind Magnussen.
2019-08-04T13:53:31Z: Red Bull pretty pleased with the position Verstappen's in right now, but the early race leader is still vulnerable. Not just because Hamilton will have fresher tyres for the long second stint, but because right now a safety car would hand the advantage to the Mercedes driver, who has a big enough gap to pit under a caution and emerge still ahead.
2019-08-04T13:53:08Z: Albon was closing on Hulkenberg, but now comes in to stop. Ahead of him, Norris and Gasly have also come in for fresh tyres.
2019-08-04T13:52:06Z: Verstappen sets a new fastest lap of 1m20.928s, and is 17.2s behind Hamilton.
2019-08-04T13:51:24Z: Leclerc is in now, and heads back out on hards. That was also the tyre Verstappen took a couple of laps ago.
2019-08-04T13:49:45Z: The Mercedes crew headed out into the pitlane again, but have left Hamilton out. Verstappen was faster than the Mercedes through the middle sector on his outlap, and now goes fastest of all in the first sector.
2019-08-04T13:48:37Z: Verstappen is in and out in 2.6s, and clear of the Ferraris, as Mercedes tells Hamilton it's 'Hammer Time'.
2019-08-04T13:48:07Z: We spoke to soon - Verstappen pits!
2019-08-04T13:47:53Z: Verstappen's not-so-subtle messages suggesting he'd prefer to stop are complicated by the gap to the Ferraris, who are just about within reach of a pitstop.
2019-08-04T13:47:46Z: Grosjean, who was running in ninth before his pitstop, has now fallen prey to Kvyat - who's going to go after Perez.
2019-08-04T13:45:26Z: Hamilton briefly gets within a second of Verstappen, but is just outside the window over the start/finish line.
2019-08-04T13:43:54Z: Ricciardo and Bottas are now on the tail of Magnussen, but can't find a way past. Kvyat now pits too.
2019-08-04T13:41:34Z: Indeed, Perez gets ahead of Grosjean! Well played by the Racing Point team.
2019-08-04T13:40:56Z: Perez has also pitted, presumably to undercut Grosjean and Hulkenberg. Grosjean comes in too.
2019-08-04T13:40:37Z: Bottas has caught right up to Ricciardo, but he's losing a huge heap of time to the front runners stuck in the pack.
2019-08-04T13:39:59Z: Hamilton is turning up the wick now. He was around four tenths faster than Verstappen on the previous lap, and 1.4s is his deficit.
2019-08-04T13:39:18Z: Lovely racing by the Toro Rosso pair! They were side-by-side all the way from turn 1 to turn 4, and Kvyat hangs on to take 12th. Haas will be recording this for training purposes.
2019-08-04T13:38:33Z: Hamilton prepares to sneak around the outside of Bottas at the start
2019-08-04T13:37:24Z: Russell and Stroll come into the pits, reacting to Giovinazzi on the previous lap. They're on hard tyres.
2019-08-04T13:36:11Z: Hamilton gets within two seconds of Verstappen for pretty much the first time since the opening couple of laps. The gap is now 1.9s.
2019-08-04T13:34:21Z: Bottas has now cleared Giovinazzi and Stroll, the latter providing a stern challenge. Russell is also easy pickings for the Finnish driver who is now up to 16th.
2019-08-04T13:32:50Z: The turbo on the Ricciardo onboard brought back memories of the sound effects from TOCA 2. Luckily, Ricciardo's Renault isn't an incongruous mix of green and yellow.
2019-08-04T13:32:03Z: The gap between Verstappen and Hamilton remains a pretty static 2.2s.
2019-08-04T13:29:59Z: Leclerc and Vettel are 12s and 14s off Verstappen respectively, but Vettel does already have 18s in hand over fifth-place man Sainz.
2019-08-04T13:29:18Z: Bottaswatch: he's now up to 19th, and Giovinazzi is next.
2019-08-04T13:28:31Z: Ferrari tells Vettel both cars are on Plan B. Is that a two-stop?
2019-08-04T13:28:29Z: Ricciardo bustled past Stroll, getting the inside line at Turn 1 and holding formation around the outside of the next corner. He's up to 16th and closing in on Magnussen, who is stuck behind Russell.
2019-08-04T13:27:24Z: Bottas is now within a second of Kubica now - that didn't take long!
2019-08-04T13:26:39Z: As for Ricciardo, he's dispatched Giovinazzi and is now closing up to Stroll. The hard tyres are working rather well.
2019-08-04T13:26:10Z: Stewards have noted no investigation is necessary over the contact between Leclerc and Bottas on the opening lap.
2019-08-04T13:25:40Z: Russell was up to 13th as a result of Bottas's pitstop, but Kvyat's managed to pass the Brit to close back up on team-mate Albon.
2019-08-04T13:25:20Z: Hamilton goes a tenth faster than Verstappen on lap eight, setting a new fastest time of 1m21.293s. 2.2s separates them at the moment.
2019-08-04T13:24:32Z: That's shuffled everyone from Sainz downwards up a place, elevating Hulkenberg into tenth.
2019-08-04T13:24:01Z: Bottas's nightmare first lap has cost Mercedes a major weapon in its arsenal over Red Bull. With Bottas/Hamilton in the mix and Verstappen acting alone with Gasly further back, Mercedes had a potentially key advantage. It could have split strategies or forced an undercut. Now the playing field is level. It's a straight fight for the win.
2019-08-04T13:23:54Z: Bottas is now last, 49s off the lead and 11s off of Kubica. He should make light work of the Williams, if he can find an overtaking spot.
2019-08-04T13:22:47Z: Bottas's stop has dropped him to last, 49s behind race leader Verstappen.
2019-08-04T13:21:46Z: Bottas pits this time round for a front-wing change and to switch to hard tyres. If necessary, that could get him to the end of the race.
2019-08-04T13:20:47Z: Replays show it was a pretty mega move from Hamilton around the outside of Bottas to grab second - considering his team-mate drifted wide - at Turn 2, and that the more significant damage to Bottas's wing was actually as a result of a hit from Leclerc as the Ferrari overtook the Mercedes driver.
2019-08-04T13:19:21Z: Hamilton goes marginally quicker than Verstappen on lap four, setting a fastest lap of 1m21.646s.
2019-08-04T13:18:48Z: Perez did manage to power up from a Q1 elimination yesterday to P12 at the start, as Sainz is ahead of Norris in the order too.
2019-08-04T13:18:32Z: Verstappen's lead is 2.2s over Hamilton, who is already three seconds clear of Leclerc. If there is to be a fight for victory today, it looks as though it'll be a two-horse one.
2019-08-04T13:17:00Z: Mercedes appears to be pondering a stop for Bottas, but he continues for now.
2019-08-04T13:16:33Z: Verstappen sets a 1m21.854s on the second lap. That's half a second quicker than Hamilton's best, as the Red Bull opens up a 2.1s lead early on.
2019-08-04T13:16:00Z: Russell has managed to get up to P14, nestled in between the two Toro Rossos. Otherwise, it's pretty static in the midfield.
2019-08-04T13:15:39Z: Verstappen's lead is already the best part of two seconds, as Vettel gets past Bottas as well now.
2019-08-04T13:15:20Z: Bottas locks up again at Turn 2, which allows Hamilton through into second - though only the world championship leader's left-rear tyre clips Bottas's front wing. There's more bad news for Bottas, too, as Leclerc mugs him for third.
2019-08-04T13:14:48Z: Shocking start for Gasly, who falls behind both McLarens and Raikkonen.
2019-08-04T13:14:06Z: It's a decent start for Verstappen, who fends off Bottas immediately and gets to the inside, then survives half a look from Bottas at the first corner as the Mercedes driver locks up.
2019-08-04T13:13:15Z: Five lights on, five lights out - the Hungarian Grand Prix is go!
2019-08-04T13:13:01Z: Everyone's on softs or mediums, apart from Daniel Ricc-hard-o.
2019-08-04T13:11:51Z: Starting tyres:Verstappen - mediumBottas - mediumHamilton - mediumLeclerc - mediumVettel - mediumGasly - mediumNorris - softSainz - softGrosjean - softRaikkonen - softHulkenberg - mediumAlbon - mediumKvyat - mediumMagnussen - mediumRussell - mediumPerez - mediumGiovinazzi - mediumStroll - mediumKubica - mediumRicciardo - hard
2019-08-04T13:09:57Z: Verstappen, meanwhile, has had his mirrors adjusted on the grid. Presumably, he's looking to keep the Mercedes pair in them.
2019-08-04T13:09:06Z: Mercedes has been fined €1000 already for Hamilton speeding in the pitlane. Oopsie-daisy.
2019-08-04T13:08:19Z: Not that we're calling Gasly a pest or anything...we'll stop this now.
2019-08-04T13:08:03Z: Perhaps a more Hungary-appropriate allegory is needed for the gap between the Red Bulls! The Buda and Pest regions are separated by the Danube. And the Buda half has the greatest elevation, so that's Max.
2019-08-04T13:05:35Z: Behind him at the start is the menacing Mercedes pair of Bottas and Hamilton. Behind them, a pair of Ferraris, with Gasly the other slice of Red Bull bread for the Mercedes/Ferrari sandwich. Crunchy.
2019-08-04T13:04:28Z: For the first time in F1, Verstappen starts on pole. He's F1's 100th polesitter, the first Dutch driver to do so, and statistically the best Verstappen. Sorry, Jos.
2019-08-04T13:01:31Z: Just 10 minutes until lights out, so stick with us for all of the action.
2019-08-04T13:01:07Z: Ladies and gentlemen, hello and welcome to the Autosport Live coverage of the Hungarian Grand Prix. It's rather sunny in Budapest, and we're Hungary for some action.
